feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Cloud Identity Services
feed.subtitle: SAP Cloud Identity Services Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: How to use urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap.odm:2.0:User in IPS to IAS
entry.content:
Hi

 

We want to use this schema during writing to IAS 

urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap.odm:2.0:User
 So added it to my target transformation
 
 

Source in EntraID, target is IAS.

when running, I get this error

error=HTTP operation failed invoking https://MyIas.accounts.ondemand.com/scim/Users/f2a458 with statusCode: 500, Response: {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"500","detail":"An internal error occurred."},


The payload does show the correct contents. 

 

Anybody knows what might be going wrong? Or to get more details on the 500 error?

 

 

Thanks

Sander

 
 
{
                "sourcePath": "$.jobTitle",
                "optional": true,
                "targetPath":"$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap.odm:2.0:User']['jobDetails']['jobTitle']"
            },



{
                "constant": "SomeText",
                "targetPath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap.odm:2.0:User']['companyCode']['company']"
            }<div> </div>

entry.title: CIS IPS add SU01 parameters to users in S/4 during creation
entry.content:
HI all,

 

We sync users from EntraID to S/4 using CIS IPS. During user creation I would like to fill several SU01 parameters of the users. 
I could not find any option in BAPI_USER_CREATE1 

 

Is it possible to have IPS fill the user parameters during creation/modification of a user?

 

thanks

Sander

entry.title: IAS/IPS sync job's error log does not display user ID/Employee IDs
entry.content:
Hi,

We are facing an issue where IAS/IPS sync job's error log does not display user ID/Employee IDs wen downloaded.

Would like to know if there is any property criteria that I need to add in order to get the user ID that is failing to sync ?

Thanks,

Kishore

entry.title: How Can We Consume Standard APIs With Business Users in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud?
entry.content:
I'm currently working on an S/4HANA Public Cloud project and have a question regarding API consumption from a business user perspective.

I’m already familiar with the technical setup — using communication users, communication arrangements, and communication systems to consume standard APIs.

However, my current need is different:
Is there a way for a business user (not a communication/technical user) to access or consume SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud standard APIs?

entry.title: IPS to S/4 set business user language
entry.content:
Hello

 

We are syncing users from EntraID to IAS, and following that from IAS to S/4

 

For the business user I want to set Correspondence language to Dutch. I tried with 

"targetPath": "$.PersonalInformation.CorrespondenceLanguage",
"constant": "N"
}

But that did not work. Tried all kinds of constants like NL or Dutch (NL). But no luck.

Does anyone know how to set the language for the business user?

 

thanks

Sander

entry.title: Technical user creation in Identity Service for implementing CI/CD ? (no email)
entry.content:
Hello,

The good practice for CI/CD is to use a technical user : "Use a technical user instead of your personal credentials. For more information, see Credential Handling. See Creating Credentials." (source).

I configured a custom Identity Provider (SAP Identity Services) to the cloud foundry sub-account. But, in the Identity Services, a valid email is required to configure the password... What is the proper way to create a technical user for CI/CD without an email (a password or a certificate valid for several months) ?

SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery SAP Cloud Identity Services SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry runtime and environment 

Thank you

Yann

entry.title: IPS Systems
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We want to use IPS to provision users from Key cloakk to SAP IAS.

Since Ke cloak is not listed in the official supported systems in the SAP Cloud Identity Services documentation https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/supported-systems?locale=en-US , we have the following questions:

Are there additional licensing costs for this?

More generally, if we connect a system to IAS that is not in the supported systems list (SAP Cloud Identity Services documentation), will there be licensing fees?

Thank you very much for any information

Best regards

entry.title: User ID for IAS users
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We provision users from Entra ID to IAS and then to cloud applications.

In the source system for Entra ID in IAS, we changed the default transformation code (user part):

Instead of:

 

 {
        "sourcePath": "$.userPrincipalName",
        "targetPath": "$.userName",
        "correlationAttribute": true
      },

we use:

{
  "sourcePath": "$.employeeId",
  "targetPath": "$.userName",
  "correlationAttribute": true
}

This way, the employee ID from Entra is provisioned to the Login Name field in IAS. When provisioning to the cloud application, a user is created with the employee ID as the user ID.

employeeId

Entra ID (employeeId) → Login Name (IAS) → User ID (SAC)

Problem:
Users created directly in IAS don’t have an employee ID, so the Login Name field in IAS is empty.

Question:
What can be used as the user ID in the cloud apps for users created directly in IAS?

 

Thank you very much for any tips

Best Regards

entry.title: Switching Cloud Identity tenant in Subaccount Trust Configuration
entry.content:
With OIDC Trusts in a Subaccount to Cloud Identity Services it's possible to switch the Cloud Identity tenant. You can simply edit the config and switch the tenant. User IDs and Authorizations remain untouched - everything works fine.

In the "old" Cloud Identity Tenant it even removes the Application and moves it to the "new" tenant.

Has anyone else used this in a production environment? Is this an official feature that's supported by SAP?

Regards

BTW here is how you can switch a Cloud Identity trust from SAML to OIDC:
Migrate from SAML Trust Configuration to OpenID Connect Trust with SAP Cloud Identity Services | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: SAP IPS: map synced EntraID Group Members to local group inside IAS
entry.content:
Hey folk,

i have the following Problem:

We have a Group i.e. entraIDGroup. This Group ist automatically synced from our EntraID to our SAP IAS. Inside our SAP IAS we have created a local Group i.e. localIasGroup. What we now want to automatically achive is that all Group Member of the synced entraIDGroup assigned to the localIasGroup. We have already follow Note: https://me.sap.com/notes/2984603/E & Blog Post: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/group-assignments-based-on-user-attributes-a-flexible-solution-for-managing/ba-p/13570696 but we dont get it worked. Our Transformation in the target system look like this:

{
    "user": {
        "condition": "($.emails EMPTY false) && ($.userName EMPTY false) && isValidEmail($.emails[0].value)",
        "mappings": [
            {
                "condition": "($.groups[?(@.value == 'entraIDGroup')].value EMPTY false)",
                "constant": "localIasGroup",
                "targetPath": "$.groups[0].value"
            },
...

I would be grateful if someone could help us find the error.

Rgs

entry.title: IAS- Notification for Migrated users from External Sites - Learning only-user
entry.content: Hi I would like to ask: if email notifications are enabled in IAS, when the ReadJob is executed for the users migrated from Learning, will they receive a notification to activate their accounts?

entry.title: SAP CIS ↔ SAP Ariba User Provisioning Issue (SCIM Schema mismatch)
entry.content:
Hello Community,

we are currently implementing user provisioning between SAP Cloud Identity Services (CIS) and SAP Ariba and followed the official SAP guide:
👉 SAP Ariba User Provisioning using SAP Identity Provisioning Service (IPS)

In this guide, it is recommended to create the following custom schema:

urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:vendor:ariba:2.0:User

We created this schema and successfully populated the attributes inside SAP CIS.
However, during provisioning from CIS to SAP Ariba, we noticed that the attributes are completely ignored and not recognized in Ariba.

The reason is a schema mismatch:

  • Schema delivered by CIS (wrong):

     
    urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap.ariba:2.0:User

  • Schema expected by Ariba SCIM API (correct):

     
    urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:ariba:2.0:User

    The difference is small (sap.ariba vs. sap:ariba), but it prevents Ariba from accepting the attributes.
    As a result, although CIS contains the attributes, they never arrive in Ariba.

    Workaround we applied

    We manually built the correct Ariba schema in CIS, adjusted the user attributes, and extended the transformations accordingly. With this workaround, provisioning into Ariba now works as expected.

    Questions to the community

    1. Is this workaround acceptable as a long-term solution, or could it cause issues with future updates?

      We would greatly appreciate any insights or experiences with similar setups 🙏

      Best regards,
      Said

entry.title: Manage single Application in SAP Cloud Identity Service
entry.content:
Hey,

I was wondering if it is possible to make the user application access public (register Button) for just one single CAP + UI5 application. This application should be accessible outside of Build-Work-Zone for Customers.

Any help in this direction would be helpful.

entry.title: create 2 source system in IAS: SF for user provisioning and ENTRA for Group Provisioning
entry.content:
Dear All,
I am seeking assistance with combining multiple sources to a single target, IAS, using automated triggers. Users will be imported from SuccessFactors, and groups will be created and provisioned from ENTRA. However, upon investigation, I have found that the assignment of these groups to users in IAS is not occurring.

Specifically, the groups are being created, but the users are not being assigned to them in IAS. I am curious to know if anyone has encountered this issue before and has any guidance on resolving it.

Best regards,

entry.title: How can we change the sender email of activation email from SAP IAS from default to custom domain
entry.content: How can we change the sender email of activation email from SAP IAS from default to custom domain. As default the sender email id is of ias@notifications.sap.com which is sap.com domain address and is sometimes confusing for the 3rd party business users to find in their mailbox. We are looking for updating this sender email address to our custom domain email ID for making the process more streamline. Also we are looking for updating the email template of activation email from IAS with our company logo and name in the template body. How can this be achieved?

entry.title: How to automate user creation and group assignment of users in IAS
entry.content: How to automate user creation and group assignment of users in IAS. We are creating external (3rd party vendors) user accounts in SAP IAS for a BTP application on daily basis. How can we approach automation of user creation and group assignment of the users from ServiceNow? The expectation is to fill a form in ServiceNow with details such as email address and group and from there the user is automatically created in IAS once the form is submitted.

entry.title: Implementing OIDC Authentication for SuccessFactors API Integration
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Requirement Overview:
We are working on integrating a front-end application with SuccessFactors. In this scenario, users log in through the front-end application and request their information from SuccessFactors. To enable this, we need to expose the SuccessFactors OData APIs to this application.

SuccessFactors OData APIs support OAuth 2.0 with SAML Assertion. The typical process is:

  1. Request a SAML assertion.

  2. Use the SAML assertion to obtain an access token.

  3. Use the access token to query the APIs.

Currently, for the SAML assertion step, we are using the /oauth/idp API to generate SAML assertions for our exposed APIs. This setup is working, but as per the official documentation (link), this method is considered insecure and has been deprecated, which may affect the APIs we expose to external systems going forward.

Proposed Solution:
We are planning to implement OIDC-based authentication for the APIs exposed from SuccessFactors to external systems.

  • We followed the official guide to configure the Identity Authentication and Identity Provisioning services (link) and attempted testing using Postman.

  • During testing (Step 10), we were asked to select the “SAP SuccessFactors” application, but the option only works when “Administration Console” is selected.

Further testing, as per this guide, yielded the following:

  • We successfully called the /oauth2/token API and obtained an ID token from the Identity Authentication service.

  • We made a second API call to obtain an API access token using the ID token from the previous step.

  • However, using this access token, we are unable to access APIs in the SAP SuccessFactors HCM suite. Getting the 401 authentication error while querying SuccessFactors OData APIs:

    Error Response:
    **********************
    {
    "error": {
    "code": "AuthenticationFailed",
    "message": "Authentication service failed to return token.",
    "details": "Failed to authenticated OIDC token"
    }
    }
    ************************

Key Requirements:

  • The official documentation suggests using grant_type=password, which we want to avoid for security reasons.

  • We intend to use grant_type=authorization_code so that users can log in via SSO through the front-end application, and their session can be used to access the APIs.

  • We would appreciate guidance on setting this up, specifically:

    1. How to configure the authentication flow for users logging in through the front-end application.

    2. How to configure it when an application (rather than users) needs to consume SuccessFactors APIs.

We request your help in setting this up correctly and securely. Leads to documentation/blog posts or any sort of help will be highly appreciated. 

@CarlosRoggan @DeepakGDeshpande 

Regards,
Pavan

entry.title: OIDC Authentication for SuccessFactors API Integration
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Requirement Overview:
We are working on integrating a front-end application with SuccessFactors. In this scenario, users log in through the front-end application and request their information from SuccessFactors. To enable this, we need to expose the SuccessFactors OData APIs to this application.

SuccessFactors OData APIs support OAuth 2.0 with SAML Assertion. The typical process is:

  1. Request a SAML assertion.

  2. Use the SAML assertion to obtain an access token.

  3. Use the access token to query the APIs.

Currently, for the SAML assertion step, we are using the /oauth/idp API to generate SAML assertions for our exposed APIs. This setup is working, but as per the official documentation (link), this method is considered insecure and has been deprecated, which may affect the APIs we expose to external systems going forward.

Proposed Solution:
We are planning to implement OIDC-based authentication for the APIs exposed from SuccessFactors to external systems.

  • We followed the official guide to configure the Identity Authentication and Identity Provisioning services (link) and attempted testing using Postman.

  • During testing (Step 10), we were asked to select the “SAP SuccessFactors” application, but the option only works when “Administration Console” is selected.

Further testing, as per this guide, yielded the following:

    Error Response:
    **********************
    {
    "error": {
    "code": "AuthenticationFailed",
    "message": "Authentication service failed to return token.",
    "details": "Failed to authenticated OIDC token"
    }
    }
    ************************

We request your help in setting this up correctly and securely. Leads to documentation/blog posts or any sort of help will be highly appreciated. 

@CarlosRoggan @DeepakGDeshpande @

Pavan

entry.title: JWT token in CAPM Application does not contain the custom attributes of IAS
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

I am facing issue in getting the custom attributes of  SAP Cloud identity services in CAPM application JWT Token. I have seen the logs of CIS. the issueJwtToken (troubleshoot using https://me.sap.com/notes/3472611) contains the custom attributes, but in the CAP application , the JWT token does not contain those attributes. Is any configuration  needs to be done in xs-security.json of CAP application to receive those attributes?

Thank you.

entry.title: Export users from SAC tenant
entry.content:
Hi everybody,

would like to know if there is a way to export users from IAS and identify which ones are synced in SAC.

There is already a feature to export users but the fields inside the report are not relevant or identifiers of SAC tenant and there is no KBA explaining or denying this is possible.

Has someone manage to do it?

Thanks!
